articles.title: Metformin's Secret Unleashed: The Anti-Hunger Molecule Mirroring Exercise - SciTechDaily
articles.description: A Stanford Medicine study found that metformin, a commonly prescribed diabetes drug associated with moderate weight loss, stimulates production of lac-phe, a molecule abundant after exercise. An “anti-hunger” molecule produced after vigorous exercise is respo…
articles.content: Researchers have found that the molecule lac-phe, produced after intense exercise, is responsible for weight loss seen in metformin users, linking it to appetite control and metabolism. Studies show … [+6589 chars]

articles.author: Science X
articles.title: People who are 'double jointed' may be at heightened risk of long COVID, says study - Medical Xpress
articles.description: People who are "double-jointed," a condition formally known as generalized joint hypermobility, may be at heightened risk of long COVID, suggests a case-control study published in the open access journal BMJ Public Health.

articles.author: Sebastian Dohm-Hansen Allard, Yvonne Nolan
articles.title: The middle-aged brain changes a lot – and it's key to understanding dementia - The Conversation
articles.description: Middle age could be a period when we can detect early risk factors of future cognitive decline.
articles.content: Our brains change more rapidly at various times of our lives, as though lifes clock was ticking faster than usual. Childhood, adolescence and very old age are good examples of this. Yet for much of a… [+4724 chars]

articles.title: School allergy management failings found by study - BBC.com
articles.description: A Cambridgeshire mum wants changes to the law to protect children with allergies after her son died.
